title: Sprouts
subheading: India's Growing Spirit - A Monument to Progress

project_details.location: AIIMS Flyover Greens, East Kidwai Nagar, New Delhi, India
project_details.scale: 40 ft tall structures spread across a 6-acre landscaped area

description.text: Commissioned as part of the Indian Government's 60 years of independence initiative, Sprouts showcases New Delhi as a 'world city'. This iconic public art installation stands 40 feet high and spans across 6 acres near the AIIMS flyover in New Delhi, making it one of India's largest public art installations.

Crafted from mirror-finished stainless steel, Sprouts embodies modernity and progress. The material choice reflects India's technological advancement and industrial development, symbolizing the nation's transformation into a modern world power.

The emerging sprouts evoke the essence of growth, renewal, and transformation. Like tender plants breaking through the earth, they represent India's emergence as a rising nation, full of potential and vitality on the global stage.

The installation creates a dynamic interplay of reflections and perspectives as viewers navigate through the expansive green space. Each viewing angle reveals new facets of the sculpture, mirroring the multifaceted nature of India's growth and development.

Sprouts has become synonymous with Delhi's identity, recognized globally as a landmark representation of contemporary Indian public art. The work stands as a testament to the nation's ambitious vision for the future.

The expansive landscape setting allows the stainless steel forms to interact with natural light throughout the day, creating ever-changing reflections that capture the dynamic essence of growth and progress that Sprouts represents.

title: Vishwakarma

project_details.scale: Kinetic installation featuring 24 hands and 12 human forms

description.text: This magnificent installation serves as the aesthetic centerpiece for Yashobhoomi in Dwarka, unveiled at the launch of the PM Vishwakarma Scheme by the Ministry of MSME, Government of India. The work was crafted under the esteemed guidance of the National Gallery of Modern Art, India.

Inspired by the sacred Ashoka Chakra, the installation features 24 hands in continuous motion, symbolizing the relentless endeavor and constant hard work of the working class. This visual metaphor celebrates the dedication and skill that form the backbone of India's economy.

The central composition comprises 12 human forms intricately crafted in mirror-finished stainless steel. These gleaming forms create dynamic reflections that celebrate the luminosity of human potential and the brilliance of traditional craftsmanship elevated to contemporary art.

The rotating hands create a sense of perpetual motion and infinite possibility, representing the cyclical nature of creation and the endless opportunities available to artisans and craftspeople under the PM Vishwakarma initiative.

This installation stands as a powerful tribute to the working artisans of India, honoring their contributions to the nation's cultural and economic heritage while inspiring future generations to embrace traditional craftsmanship.

title: Bodhi Tree
subheading: A Spiritual Beacon on the Seas

project_details.location: Utopia of the Seas, Royal Caribbean International
project_details.material: Stainless Steel and Integrated Light Technology

description.text: A breathtaking 65-foot tall light-art installation created exclusively for Royal Caribbean's Utopia of the Seas, the second-largest cruise ship in the world. This monumental work brings artistic splendor to the open seas, creating a spiritual sanctuary within a modern vessel.

Inspired by the sacred Bodhi tree from ancient spiritual traditions, this installation channels the profound symbolism of enlightenment and awakening. The Bodhi tree represents the timeless human quest for wisdom, peace, and transcendence.

The luminous form of Bodhi Tree combines cutting-edge light technology with spiritual symbolism, creating an immersive experience for cruise passengers. The glowing structure serves as a beacon of hope and spiritual contemplation amidst the vast ocean.

The installation encompasses themes of abundance, prosperity, and the fulfillment of desires—universal aspirations reflected in the sacred tree mythology. Passengers encounter not just an artwork, but a meditation on human hopes and dreams.

description.text: Inaugurated by Home Minister Shri Amit Shah at the Vadnagar, Gujarat Museum, 'Sangam' is a captivating sculpture that masterfully intertwines the fabric of past, present, and future. This work celebrates the convergence of temporal dimensions and cultural continuity.

Crafted in mirror-finish and antique stainless steel, the sculpture features intricate convex and concave surfaces that reflect the weathered textures of Vadnagar's historic walls. These undulating forms symbolize the passage of time and the accumulated wisdom of generations.

The interplay between polished and textured surfaces creates a visual narrative of transformation and continuity. Each curve and ridge tells stories of historical layers, cultural evolution, and the enduring spirit of this ancient city.

Sangam stands as a tribute to Vadnagar's rich heritage and its contemporary significance. The installation invites visitors to contemplate how historical wisdom informs present-day consciousness and shapes our collective future.

title: Joy
subheading: A Celebration of Life's Simple Pleasures

description.text: A magnificent 30-foot tall public art installation located in Dubai Creek Harbour, United Arab Emirates. Created as part of Art EMAAR's initiative, Joy stands as a permanent tribute to the beauty, happiness, and purity inherent in life.

The installation takes the enchanting form of a bouquet of balloons, evoking childhood wonder and the simple delights that bring meaning to our lives. The shimmering metallic forms celebrate innocent joy and unbridled optimism.

Crafted with mirror-finished stainless steel, Joy reflects the ever-changing Dubai skyline and the dynamic environment around it. Viewers encounter themselves mirrored in the sculpture's surface, creating a personal connection with the artwork's message of joy and self-reflection.

The carefully composed balloon forms rise majestically, capturing the essence of buoyancy and lightness. Each element contributes to a harmonious composition that celebrates life's capacity to uplift and inspire.

Positioned near the future Dubai Creek Tower, Joy serves as a beacon of positivity and human aspiration. The work transforms the urban landscape, inviting passersby to pause and reconnect with the pure joy that exists in the present moment.

The installation has become an iconic landmark in Dubai, recognized globally as a symbol of Art EMAAR's commitment to elevating public spaces through contemporary art that celebrates universal human emotions.

title: Pratibimb
subheading: A Mirror of Time and Reflection

project_details.material: Mirror-finish Stainless Steel and Indistinctly Polished Metal

description.text: Inaugurated at the Vadnagar, Gujarat Museum by Home Minister Shri Amit Shah, 'Pratibimb' is a thought-provoking sculpture that invites contemplation on the convergence of past, present, and self. The work explores humanity's complex relationship with time and identity.
A large, intentionally blurred disc represents the vast, often indistinct past—those forgotten moments and accumulated experiences that shape who we are yet remain obscured by the passage of time.

Smaller, mirror-finished convex and concave discs symbolize the crystalline clarity of the present moment and the infinite possibilities of the future. These reflective surfaces invite self-examination and personal contemplation.

The artwork creates a visual metaphor for human consciousness and existence. As viewers interact with the reflective surfaces, they become part of the installation, experiencing the blurred memory of the past and the sharp clarity of present awareness.

title: Mahatma
subheading: Honoring the Father of the Nation

project_details.location: Bharat Mandapam Grounds / Public Spaces, New Delhi, India

description.text: Executed with the support of the Ministry of Culture and the National Gallery of Modern Art, India, 'Mahatma' is a stainless steel sculpture created for the PARI (Public Art Project of India) initiative. The work pays homage to Mahatma Gandhi, the transformative leader who shaped modern India.

The sculpture draws profound inspiration from Gandhi's life and enduring legacy. It reflects his unwavering commitment to truth (Satya) and righteousness, principles that guided his non-violent struggle for independence and continue to inspire humanity worldwide.

Crafted in mirror-finished stainless steel, the work captures the essence of Gandhi's spiritual and moral clarity. The reflective surface invites viewers to contemplate the universal values of truth, non-violence, and human dignity that Gandhi embodied.

The minimalist forms of the sculpture convey Gandhi's ascetic lifestyle and profound simplicity. In the interplay of light and reflection, the work conveys the transcendent power of moral conviction and spiritual strength.

Mahatma serves as a contemporary meditation on leadership rooted in principle rather than power. The work reminds viewers that true greatness emerges from unwavering commitment to justice and human welfare.

As part of the PARI initiative, this sculpture contributes to India's ongoing celebration of artistic expression and cultural heritage, positioning Gandhi's timeless wisdom at the intersection of contemporary art and national identity.

project_details.material: Antique Brass, Antique Copper, and Stainless Steel

description.text: Unveiled at the Vadnagar, Gujarat Museum under the patronage of Home Minister Shri Amit Shah, this decorative map is crafted from antique brass, antique copper, and stainless steel. The work transforms geographical information into an artistic celebration of cultural heritage.

The map identifies and highlights the important historical and contemporary points of Vadnagar, serving as both educational tool and aesthetic object. Each landmark represented carries stories of centuries of cultural significance and human achievement.

The layered materials—brass, copper, and steel—create visual depth and historical richness. The warm tones of copper and brass contrast beautifully with stainless steel, reflecting Vadnagar's blend of ancient tradition and modern identity.

title: Kalpavriksha
subheading: The Wish-Fulfilling Tree of Eternal Aspiration

description.text: Standing majestically at 35 feet tall in Arvind Uplands, Ahmedabad, India, Kalpavriksha is a luminous light sculpture that brings ancient mythology into contemporary urban space. The work draws inspiration from the sacred wish-fulfilling tree of Hindu mythology.

Crafted entirely from mirror-finished steel balls arranged in the form of a tree, Kalpavriksha represents eternal love, immortality, and fertility. The spherical elements create a shimmering surface that dances with light throughout the day.

During daylight hours, the polished steel balls reflect the sky and surroundings, creating a dynamic interplay of colors and light. The sculpture becomes a meditation on how human aspirations and desires mirror the infinite possibilities of the universe.

At night, the installation comes alive with a dynamic glow that transforms the entire landscape. The illuminated structure becomes a beacon of hope and inspiration, reminiscent of a celestial tree connecting earth and sky.

title: Deepam
subheading: Floating Lights of Hope and Unity

project_details.scale: Approximately 70 floating units spread over 100 meters

description.text: Handcrafted in brass with controlled undulations carefully introduced to magnify the effect of dancing amber flames, these floating Deepams celebrate Amsterdam's 750th anniversary from October 2024 onwards. The work bridges Indian spiritual traditions with European urban culture.

Inspired by Diwali, the beloved Indian festival of lights, this installation comprises approximately 70 floating Deepams spread over 100 meters in Amsterdam's canal. The illuminated water creates an ethereal landscape of golden reflections and spiritual warmth.

Each handcrafted Deepam is a unique creation, with carefully engineered undulations that enhance the flickering amber flame. The traditional oil lamp design honors centuries of Indian spiritual practice while speaking a contemporary language of artistic expression.

The installation transforms Amsterdam's canals into a landscape of soft golden light, inviting viewers to partake in the universal spirit of Diwali. The work transcends cultural boundaries, celebrating light and hope as universal human experiences.

Deepam shares the message of light triumphing over darkness and hope prevailing over despair. As an artistic dialogue between India and Europe, the work celebrates humanity's shared values of illumination, renewal, and communal celebration.

The floating installation creates a dynamic interaction between art, water, light, and human emotion. Viewers moving along the canal experience an ever-changing perspective of the luminous Deepams, each moment revealing new layers of spiritual meaning.

title: Peepal
subheading: The Inverted Tree of Sacred Wisdom

project_details.location: Vibhor Mahal, Tijara Fort Palace, Rajasthan, India

description.text: A site-specific installation at Tijara Fort Palace in Rajasthan, India, Peepal occupies a specially designated space named 'Vibhor Mahal' in honor of the artist. This work reimagines ancient Hindu reverence for the inverted banyan tree through contemporary sculptural language.

Inspired by the mystical image of a banyan tree with roots pointing upwards and branches extending downward, whose leaves are said to be Vedic hymns. Peepal transforms this metaphorical botanical form into a tangible artistic experience within a palace environment.

The installation invites viewers to contemplate the reversed relationship between earth and sky, material and spiritual, visible and invisible. The upside-down orientation challenges conventional perspectives and awakens deeper philosophical inquiry.

Within the atmospheric space of 'Vibhor Mahal,' Peepal creates an environment of contemplation and spiritual awakening. The artwork serves as a meditation on the connection between ancient wisdom and contemporary artistic practice.

The site-specific nature of Peepal ensures a unique relationship with Tijara Fort's historical and architectural context. The work honors both the spiritual traditions of Hindu philosophy and the cultural heritage of Rajasthan.

title: Through the Depths
subheading: From Raw Stone to Timeless Treasure

project_details.location: Stonex India Manufacturing Unit, Kishangarh, Rajasthan, India
project_details.material: 316 Grade Mirror-finished Stainless Steel and Natural Stone Globe
project_details.scale: 12 ft tall structure on elevated surface

description.text: 'Through the Depths' is an ode to the profound process of transformation and human refinement. The work symbolizes the journey of raw stone extracted from the earth's depths, transformed through skilled craftsmanship into a timeless treasure of beauty and meaning.

The sculpture celebrates the alchemical process by which rough, unpolished material becomes refined and valuable. This metaphorical journey mirrors human spiritual and personal development, where challenges and pressures forge character and brilliance.

The artwork invites contemplation on the value of perseverance and transformation. Just as stone must be extracted, shaped, and polished to reveal its inherent beauty, human potential requires similar dedication and refinement to manifest fully.

The polished surfaces of Through the Depths create dynamic reflections that change with light and viewer perspective. Each reflection reminds us that transformation is never complete—we continuously evolve and refract new meanings throughout our existence.

This installation celebrates the noble work of craftspeople and artists who dedicate their lives to revealing the hidden beauty within raw materials. The work honors both the material world and the human capacity for creative transformation.

title: Tidal Tango
subheading: The Rhythm of Ocean and Life

project_details.location: Exhibited at ADFF:STIR Mumbai / Studio Sogani Collection
project_details.scale: Medium to Large scale sculptural work

description.text: In the mesmerizing dance of ocean waves, we find profound reflections of life's own rhythms and harmonies. 'Tidal Tango' is a sculptural ode to the dynamic yet symphonic union of two waves, capturing the eternal dialogue between power and serenity.

Crafted in mirror-finish stainless steel, Tidal Tango distills the beauty of collision and convergence. Two powerful waves frozen in dynamic interaction represent the inevitable meetings, conflicts, and harmonies that define both natural and human experience.

The polished steel surfaces create a mesmerizing interplay of reflections, inviting viewers to contemplate the intersections of power, serenity, and the eternal ebb and flow of life. Each viewing angle reveals new facets of the sculptural dialogue.

Tidal Tango celebrates the poetic beauty of water in motion and the spiritual significance of tidal forces. The work reminds us that life, like the tides, moves in cycles—advancing and retreating, rising and falling, in an eternal dance of transformation.

'Balancing Act' is a series that captures the essence of a tightrope walk, reflecting life's delicate interplay between stability and instability, harmony and chaos. The works feature undulating surfaces that create dynamic, ever-shifting reflections.

The undulating surfaces generate a visual rhythm of movement and stillness, representing the constant navigation required to maintain equilibrium in life. The rippled forms suggest both difficulty and grace in the act of balancing.

Contrasted with crisp, almost flawless polished segments, the works explore duality and complementarity. This interplay between perfection and imperfection, order and chaos, creates a profound meditation on the nature of existence itself.

title: Pool of Dreams
main_image: https://vibhorsogani.com//admin/assets/images/work/1730590344_18 - Pool of Dreams by Vibhor Sogani - Copyright Janus van den Eijnden (1), ALF.jpg

project_details.material: Mirror-finished Stainless Steel Orbs and LED technology
project_details.scale: Over 100 spheres ranging from 3.5 to 7 feet in height

description.text: Created for the 12th edition of Amsterdam Light Festival 2023, 'Pool of Dreams' was selected among only 24 artists from 8 countries, with Sogani being the sole Indian participant. The installation features polished steel orbs that playfully rise from the water and spill onto adjacent land.

Comprising over 100 mirror-finished stainless steel spheres ranging from 3.5 to 7 feet in height, Pool of Dreams creates an otherworldly landscape of reflections and dreams. Each sphere functions as a lens, fragmenting and multiplying the surrounding environment.

The installation explores the relationship between art, light, and technology in response to the festival's theme 'LOADING.' The shimmering orbs represent the fluidity of digital consciousness and the dreamlike quality of imagination in the technological age.
Now a permanent feature of Amsterdam's Light Art Collection, Pool of Dreams has also been showcased at Aarhus Festuge 2024 in Denmark, extending its dialogue across European cities and cultures.

The polished spheres interact dynamically with their environment throughout day and night, creating continuously shifting reflections. Viewers become part of the artwork, their movements and presence mirrored within the pool of steel dreams.
